entry.title: The Welfare Reform (2007 Act) (Commencement No. 4 and Consequential Provisions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: Article 2 of this Order provides for the coming into operation of sections 36 (directions by Department) and 45 (loss of benefit for commission of benefit offences) of, and paragraphs 2 to 4 of Schedule 5 (minor and consequential amendments) to, the Welfare Reform Act (Northern Ireland) 2007 on 1st April 2008.

title.div: The Ceredigion and Mid Wales National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Staff, Property, Rights and Liabilities) Order 2008 / Gorchymyn Ymddiriedolaeth Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Ceredigion a Chanolbarth Cymru (Trosglwyddo Staff, Eiddo, Hawliau a Rhwymedigaethau) 2008

div.p: This Order provides for the transfer of staff from Ceredigion and Mid Wales National Health Service Trust to the Hywel Dda National Health Service Trust from the 1 April 2008.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn darparu ar gyfer trosglwyddo staff o Ymddiriedolaeth Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Ceredigion a Chanolbarth Cymru i Ymddiriedolaeth Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Hywel Dda o 1 Ebrill 2008 ymlaen.

title.div: The North Glamorgan National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Staff, Property, Rights and Liabilities) Order 2008 / Gorchymyn Ymddiriedolaeth Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Gogledd Morgannwg (Trosglwyddo Staff, Eiddo, Hawliau a Rhwymedigaethau) 2008

div.p: This Order provides for the transfer of staff from the North Glamorgan National Health Service Trust to the Cwm Taf National Health Service Trust from the 1 April 2008.
Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn darparu ar gyfer trosglwyddo staff o Ymddiriedolaeth Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Gogledd Morgannwg i Ymddiriedolaeth Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Cwm Taf o 1 Ebrill 2008 ymlaen.

title.div: The Bro Morgannwg National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Staff, Property, Rights and Liabilities) Order 2008 / Gorchymyn Ymddiriedolaeth Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Bro Morgannwg (Trosglwyddo Staff, Eiddo, Hawliau a Rhwymedigaethau) 2008

div.p: This Order provides for the transfer of staff from Bro Morgannwg National Health Service Trust to the Abertawe Bro Morgannwg University National Health Service Trust from the 1 April 2008.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn darparu ar gyfer trosglwyddo staff o Ymddiriedolaeth Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Bro Morgannwg i Ymddiriedolaeth Brifysgol Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol Abertawe Bro Morgannwg o 1 Ebrill 2008 ymlaen.

entry.title: The Protected Trust Deeds (Scotland) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under paragraph 5 of Schedule 1 to the Bankruptcy (Scotland) Act 1985, as amended by the Bankruptcy and Diligence etc (Scotland) Act 2007. They make provision about how trust deeds become protected, the consequences of a trust deed being granted that status, the rights of creditors, the discharge of the debtor and trustee from the trust deed, and the administration of trust deeds.

entry.title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Levies) (Amendment) Regulations 2008 (revoked)
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Occupational Pension Schemes (Levies) Regulations 2005 (S.I. 2005/842) (“the Levies Regulations”).

entry.title: The Civil Enforcement of Parking Contraventions (Penalty Charge Notices, Enforcement and Adjudication) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Civil Enforcement of Parking Contraventions (Penalty Charge Notices, Enforcement and Adjudication) (Wales) Regulations 2008/609.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (virt-x Exchange Limited) (Amendment) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (virt-x Exchange Limited) Regulations 1995 (S.I. 1995/2051). The purpose of the amendments is to reflect the change of name of virt-x Exchange Limited to SWX Europe Limited. The change of name was effective from 3rd March 2008 and these Regulations come into force as soon as possible after that date, on 18th April 2008.

entry.title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Levy Ceiling) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Occupational Pension Schemes (Levy Ceiling) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order specifies, for the purposes of section 177 of the Pensions Act 2004 (c.35) (“the Act”), the levy ceiling for the financial year beginning on 1st April 2008.

entry.title: The Relevant Authorities (Code of Conduct) (Prescribed Period for Undertakings) (Wales) Order 2008
entry.summary: So far as is relevant to this Order, section 183 of the Local Government and Public Involvement in Health Act 2007 provides that a person who, immediately before the coming into force of that section, is a member or co-opted member of a relevant authority in Wales (other than a police authority) will cease to be a member or co-opted member of the authority unless before the end of “the prescribed period”, he has given the authority a written undertaking to observe the authority’s code of conduct.

entry.title: The Civil Legal Aid (Financial Conditions) (Scotland) Regulations 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Civil Legal Aid (Financial Conditions) (Scotland) Regulations 2008

entry.summary: These Regulations increase certain financial limits of eligibility for civil legal aid under the Legal Aid (Scotland) Act 1986.

entry.title: Donaghadee (Harbour Area) Order (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: This Order fixes the area at Donaghadee Harbour within which the powers of the Harbour Commissioners may be exercised.

entry.title: The Pension Protection Fund (Pension Compensation Cap) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Pension Protection Fund (Pension Compensation Cap) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order specifies the amount of the compensation cap for the purposes of paragraph 26(7) of Schedule 7 to the Pensions Act 2004 (c.35) (“the Act”), in accordance with paragraph 27(2) and (3) of that Schedule (article 2).

entry.title: The Department for Transport (Driver Licensing and Vehicle Registration Fees) (Amendment) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Department for Transport (Driver Licensing and Vehicle Registration Fees) (Amendment) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order, which is made under section 102(3) and (4) of the Finance (No. 2) Act 1987, amends the Department for Transport (Driver Licensing and Vehicle Registration Fees) Order 2003 (S.I. 2003/2994) (“the Principal Order”). It specifies two additional powers in the Road Traffic Act 1988 (“the 1988 Act”) to fix a fee; the powers in section 99(7ZA) (power to prescribe a fee for the renewal of a photocard driving licence) and the powers in section 105(2)(e) (power to prescribe a fee for the replacement of a lost or defaced driving licence). This will require the Secretary of State for Transport, when setting those fees, to take account of the functions and matters specified in the Principal Order in addition to any other functions and matters already required to be taken into account. An additional effect of making an order under section 102(3) and (4) of the 1987 Act is that any earlier exercise of the power to fix a fee covered by it, which would have been validated by this Order had it been made before the exercise, is automatically validated by section 102(6).

entry.title: The Local Involvement Networks (Duty of Services-Providers to Allow Entry) Regulations 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Local Involvement Networks (Duty of Services-Providers to Allow Entry) Regulations 2008

entry.summary: These Regulations impose a duty on services-providers requiring them to allow authorised representatives of local involvement networks to enter and view certain premises owned or controlled by certain services-providers and to allow authorised representatives to observe the carrying-on of certain activities on such premises.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Commencement No. 1) (Northern Ireland) Order 2008

ukm:Subject.Value: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, NORTHERN IRELAND
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, NORTHERN IRELAND

category.term: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, NORTHERN IRELAND
PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, NORTHERN IRELAND

entry.summary: This is the second Commencement Order made under the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (“the Act”), but the first which commences provisions in so far as they extend to Northern Ireland.

entry.title: The Advice and Assistance (Financial Conditions) (Scotland) Regulations 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Advice and Assistance (Financial Conditions) (Scotland) Regulations 2008

entry.summary: This version of the The Advice and Assistance (Financial Conditions) (Scotland) Regulations 2008 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Local Government and Public Involvement in Health Act 2007 (Commencement No.5 and Transitional, Saving and Transitory Provision) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order commences further provisions of the Local Government and Public Involvement in Health Act 2007 (c.28) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Offender Management Act 2007 (Consequential Amendments) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Offender Management Act 2007 (Consequential Amendments) Order 2008

entry.summary: This Order makes amendments consequential to Part 1 of the Offender Management Act 2007 (“the OMA 2007”) which contains new arrangements for the provision of probation services. The OMA 2007 places a statutory duty on the Secretary of State to ensure that sufficient probation services are provided throughout England and Wales and enables the Secretary of State to make contractual or other arrangements with providers of probation services for the provision of probation services. The OMA 2007 also establishes probation trusts. The arrangements in the OMA 2007 are to be brought into force by geographical areas in phases and will replace the arrangements in respect of the National Probation Service for England and Wales contained in Part 1 of the Criminal Justice and Court Services Act 2000 (“the CJCSA 2000”), which place the duty for ensuring sufficient provision of probation services on local probation boards.

entry.title: The Bedfordshire (Structural Changes) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order provides for the establishment, on 1st April 2009, of a single tier of local government for the borough of Bedford and a single tier of local government for the remainder of the county of Bedfordshire (articles 3 to 5). The county of Bedfordshire and, with the exception of the borough of Bedford, the districts within that county, are abolished on 1st April 2009.
